timeline.bodyText: I am getting complaints from both IDEA and TeamCity about this:  JUnit test method testImpossibleExceptionsJava14TextBlockLexer() contains no assertions which I understand, but why don't the existing tests (see here) cause this warning?
timeline.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText:
This means either there is a suppression in the config, or somewhere it is specified that AssertGeneratedJavaLexer.verifyFail is an assertion method.
A quick search finds these rules:
https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/config/pmd-test.xml#L182
https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml#L4618
(the list may be incomplete)
replies.author: pbludov

timeline.bodyText: I would like to know a better way to reuse the existing code (see here) .  Should I make AssertGeneratedJavaLexer.java not final, then extend it, or should I refactor AssertGeneratedJavaLexer.java to work with the new lexer, too?
timeline.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: This class is final simply because there was no reason not to make it final before. If you need to re-factor this to support the grammar for text blocks, then go ahead.
replies.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText: After re-examining this, since each class must be a descendant of it's respective lexer, and an interface for these seems like overkill, I am going to leave this as it is.
replies.author: nmancus1

timeline.bodyText:
I would rather do no coverage for such hard to catch code and and bump percentage in config.
we keep percentage in coverage for generated code only to see diff of coverage on new grammar update and probably discuss what could be covered by real inputs.
We do not need to have test on generated code of ANTLR, it is by definition the most trusty code in our code base.
in addition  we always work on javac compiled sources, so we do not care how code works on incomplete/non-compilable java code
timeline.author: romani

ok, looks like @rnveach  was a person who introduced such asserts - 5123ab3 .
ok, lets keep it.

We should mention that we substitude invisible '\n' (in linux single char symbol) with \n (2 chars).
By means of this we increase length of String object.
.... stop ...
Can we put in actual String symbol as is ? (single char)
is it a nuance of you AST printer that we need show content in single line and Printer is doing escapes ?
If this is a problems of AST printer - IT IS NOT a problem at all. Nobody care about our AST printer, nobody use it except for us in some cases.

replies.bodyText: So, we aren't miscounting the actual line terminators, but our length is not accurate due to counting the whitespace preceding the text.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText:
It is good that keep spaces !!!!
We care about source file as text , not in what it result after compilation ( compiler remove a lot of stuff from source code, it is grey area). We might change this in future if there be bug demand.
